thread.title: People's Insurance Group of China plans to raise over $1.6 billion in Shanghai IPO

title: People's Insurance Group of China plans to raise over $1.6 billion in Shanghai IPO

organizations.name: people's insurance company (group) of china ltd
people’s insurance group of china co ltd
picc property and casualty co ltd

text:
April 10, 2018 / 12:02 AM / Updated an hour ago People's Insurance Group of China plans to raise over $1.6 billion in Shanghai IPO Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - People’s Insurance Group of China Co Ltd (PICC) ( 1339.HK ), parent of the nation’s biggest non-life insurer, said it aims to raise over 10 billion yuan (1.1 billion pounds) on the Shanghai stock exchange to replenish its capital. FILE PHOTO: A man walks past a backdrop during an investors meeting of The People's Insurance Company (Group) of China Ltd (PICC) in Hong Kong November 22, 2012. REUTERS/Bobby Yip/File Photo 
PICC said late on Monday in a post to the Hong Kong stock exchange that it plans to issue up to 4.6 billion A-shares in a Shanghai initial public offering. 
PICC’s listing in China would come more than four years after the company went public in a $3.1 billion offering in Hong Kong. PICC is the parent of PICC Property and Casualty Co Ltd ( 2328.HK ). 
The deal will be underwritten by China International Capital Corp Ltd ( 3908.HK ), Essence Securities, CITIC Securities Co Ltd ( 600030.SS ) and Goldman Sachs Gao Hua Securities, according to the prospectus posted by China’s securities regulator. Reporting by Hong Kong newsroom and Engen Tham in Shanghai; Editing by Stephen Coates
